Discharge Plan
Disposition
Assessment:
The patient was found to have Anemia and Dr Seven and his staff diagnosed the condition and treated Ms Rebecca for Anemia during the 2 day stay at Community Health Hospitals. Ms Rebecca recovered from Anemia during the stay and is being discharged in a stable condition. If there is fever greater than 101.5 F or onset of chest pain/breathlessness the patient is advised to contact emergency.
Plan of Treatment:
Schedule an appointment with Dr Seven after 1 week for Follow up with Outpatientfacility for Immunosuppressive therapy.
Health Concerns:
a. Chronic Sickness exhibited by patient
b. HealthCare Concerns refer to underlying clinical facts
i. Documented HyperTension problem
ii. Documented HypoThyroidism problem
iii. Watch Weight of patient
iv. Documented Anemia problem
Hospital Course:
test hosptial course
Care Plan Goals:
a. Need to gain more energy to do regular activities.
b. Negotiated Goal to keep Body Temperature at 98-99 degrees Fahrenheit with regular monitoring.
Activity Restrictions/Additional Instructions:
a. Diet: Diabetic low salt diet
b. Medications: Take prescribed medications as advised.
c. Appointments: Schedule an appointment with Dr Seven after 1 week. Follow up with Outpatient facility for Immunosuppression treatment.
d. For Fever of > 101.5 F, or onset of chest pain/breathlessness contact Emergency.
e. For pain take Tylenol as needed

tr.td:
The patient was found to have Anemia and Dr Seven and his staff diagnosed the condition and treated
Ms Rebecca for Anemia during the 2 day stay at Community Health Hospitals. Ms Rebecca recovered from
Anemia during the stay and is being discharged in a stable condition. If there is fever greater than
101.5 F or onset of chest pain/breathlessness the patient is advised to contact emergency.

tr.td:
a. Need to gain more energy to do regular activities.
b. Negotiated Goal to keep Body Temperature at 98-99 degrees Fahrenheit with regular monitoring.

Exhibit appropriate behavior
* Identifies appropriate behavior for given situation
* Verbalizes need for assistance with situation

Exhibit appropriate behavior
* Identifies appropriate behavior for given situation
* Verbalizes need for assistance with situation

Achieve optimal elimination pattern
* Maintains fluid and electrolyte balance
* Demonstrates normal bowel pattern
* Demonstrates normal bladder pattern

Identify specific home maintenance plan
* Identifies factors that restrict self-care
* Identifies factors that restrict environment management

Increase ability to cope with caregiving
* Identifies controllable stressors
* Identifies sources of support
* Identifies possible changes to current life style
* Discusses alternative ways to meet demands of situation

Maintain adequate fluid volume
* Maintain adequate intake/output and electrolyte balance
* Maintains vital signs WNL
* Maintains clear breath sounds
* Exhibits no edema

Adequate cardiac output
* Achieves hemodynamic stability
* Maintains vital signs WNL
* Exhibits no adventitious breath sounds

Exhibit optimal tissue perfusion
* Exhibits adequate oxygenation and ventilation
* Exhibits adequate cardiac output
* Regains stable cardiac rhythm
* Maintains optimal activity level
* Maintains balanced intake and output

Maintain optimal nutritional status
* Maintains weight within 10% of IBW
* Maintains adequate caloric intake

Remain free of infection
* Maintains vital signs WNL
* Evidences no purulent drainage from wounds, incisions, and tubes
* Maintains lab values WNL

Understand disease process
* Understands anatomy and physiology
* Describes reportable s/s
* Understands treatment plan
* Understands medication regime

section.title: Hospital Discharge Instructions
section.text:
Additional Instructions
a. Diet: Diabetic low salt diet
b. Medications: Take prescribed medications as advised.
c. Appointments: Schedule an appointment with Dr Seven after 1 week. Follow up with Outpatient
facility for Immunosuppression treatment.
d. For Fever of > 101.5 F, or onset of chest pain/breathlessness contact Emergency.
e. For pain take Tylenol as needed
